fields.summary: Error when open sourcetree after update

fields.description:
We’ve all experienced the incredible slowness of SourceTree and Atlassian’s attempts at getting it under control, but there might be something you can do going forward. Part of the problem is that we don’t actually know what causes SourceTree to stall and appear to sit there waiting.

I recommend that we *add a window* which the user can bring up at will *which will list all the ongoing operations.* It should be a tabular list (GridView?) that shows the affected repo name, full path, and the operation (e.g. “git push”, “git add <file> <file>”, etc.).

This will allow users to get a better feel for what kinds of operations cause SourceTree to slow down and approximately how long until it will return to bearable operation. Further, it will allow you to better target what operations require improvement/optimization instead of guessing.
fields.summary: Add window showing the source of performance problems
Crash app

fields.description:
As seen in: [https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/STSP-6988]

 

The diffmerge option currently works, however, the preferences need to be set each time SourceTree starts. It seems that we are not saving the configuration correctly.
fields.summary: SourceTree does not save diffmerge preferences

fields.description:
Created a release using sourcetree's git flow button, made changes to source, committed. Then tried finish release.

Getting FATAL error about the -f option not being supported (see image)
fields.summary: Unable to finish release with git-flow
not able to apply stash if the any one of the file changed in the server or working copy

fields.description: My password recently changed. I have updated my credentials in the authentication preferences in SourceTree, however UI pulls always fail due to an authentication error, even though my credentials are correct.  If I run the exact same command in the terminal, the pull is successful.
fields.summary: Authentication fails on UI pull, works in command line.

fields.description:
When the commit button is pressed, nothing happens.

"Push changes immediately to <branch>" is greyed out.

After an unspecified amount of time (many seconds, occasionally minutes) "Push changes immediately to <branch>" goes back to fully black, and then a commit can proceed.

When in the greyed out state, I can commit my changes via commandline just fine.
fields.summary: Commit button does not work

fields.description: We have the precondition, that all software has to be installed through citrix software distribution. This means we won't have the possibility to install a license while installing. We would need a silent option for the installer, maybe with a company wide license?
fields.summary: Install Sourcetree through citrix software distribution not possible
What the fuck did you do in latest update ???

fields.description:
Discarding staged file discards unstaged changes as well.

So if you have a file with different changes and you have staged some line of that file. If you decide right click on it and discard, then it discards the whole file, not only the staged changes, but also the unstaged changes.
fields.summary: Discarding staged file discards unstaged changes as well

fields.description:
Add 'Open External Difference viewer' to log//history

I am looking at a commit that was already commited and pushed.
I can see the changes in the Log/History tab.

It does not seem to be possible to view the differences in an external tool here.

Sometimes that can be helpfull. Is it possible to add this option to the dropdown menu for a file ni the Log./History tab?
fields.summary: Add 'Open External Difference viewer' to log//history

fields.description:
The GA update of Sourcetree 2.3.1.0 was announced on several machines with Windows 7 64 Bit in our team. Two team members were not able to update.

The update process in steps:
- SourceTree announced the update to 2.3.1.0
- Update was started and took around 1 minute
- Windows app crash of the application dialog (selection: stop application - German: Anwendung schließen)
- After the Windows app crash dialog was closed SourceTree reported the update was successful and should be restarted

--> After restarting SourceTree the old application is still installed and no more updates are shown also when manually checking for new updates in the Options menu.

Comments about the update procedure:
The update process seems to be severely broken ... also some of the last GA releases showed similar effects on some of our developer machines.
In case we want to update to a newer version I know we probably have to remove everything old and install fresh from scratch. Currently the official download from https://www.sourcetreeapp.com/ is still 2.1.11.0 so please also offer a current download for the newest version as well in case that is not already planned.
fields.summary: Update to Sourcetree 2.1.3.0 from older versions of SourceTree fails after app crash

fields.description:
Opening the Custom Actions tab in the Sourcetree Options and trying to [Add] a new custom actions the buttons in the lower right corner of the dialog are cut off.

Buttons OK and Cancel cut off in Edit Custom Action dialog
fields.summary: Buttons OK and Cancel cut off in Edit Custom Action dialog

fields.description:
Push-dialog is not getting appropriate focus. Steps to reproduce

1) Stage changes and write a commit-message

2) Press Ctrl+return to add the commit

3) Press Ctrl+shift+p to open the Push-dialog

4) Try to press Return (to perform the push-operation) and see that the focus is still on the (now empty) commit-dialog below (in which a new line has now been added)

 

The focus should be changed to the "Push"-button when the dialog is opened.
fields.summary: Push-dialog not getting focus

fields.description: When I press 'Esc' key modal dialog is not closing.
fields.summary: Basic Accessibility in Pull Modal Popup

fields.description:
*Commit View does not detect a merge has finished*

Before the update when I pressed save in p4merge and closed it, sourcetree would detect that the merge is done.

*Commit View does not reflect actions*

The commit view does not reflect any actions on the files it lists. Before 2.3.1.0 it alreaedy was bugged and I had to switch the filter. Now it does not work at all anymore.

*Resolve does not work at all*

I am unable to resolve with ANY option. Not even restart the conflict resolution works.

*Open Action does nothing for half the filetypes (non-binary)*

The option action simply does nothing for half the non standard but non binary files (.meta, .cginc, .unity, .prefab. Unity files set to their string version and i can manually open them but not with sourcetree anymore).

It really feels like there is a huge decline since Sourcetree 2.0 all of these slowly began to happen minor version after minor version. I have even changed the PC in the meantime so now it really is running on a clean system. Yeah I know I can simply go back to an old version, and I will do that, but in case more people have the same problems I hope they report it and some of those things can be fixed.

Edit2: Many issues listed above seem related to interacting "too quickly". When I do not wait some time after the UI interaction has fully processed and give it some time I can reproduce many errors, which lead to "can not do this - check if the file is not open", which likely is open by sourcetree itself, altough the UI popup for the action already was closed.
fields.summary: Unable to work with sourcetree since the new update 2.3.1.0 - Commit View seems completly broken

fields.description:
After update today i am able to switch branches with uncommitted changes.
The uncommitted changes stay in source tree as uncommitted changes in the newly checked out branch!
Now i cannot be sure i have any safeguards between branches
ScreenShots show an immediate switch between branches and the filestatus.
is changes are stashed the files will be reflected correctly in local folders.
fields.summary: Able to Switch branches with uncommited changes

But when source-tree changed its UI to have the menus on the title bar I started to have some UI glitches where the menu would disappear , only becoming visible when hovering with the mouse and also the minimize, maximise and close buttons on the title would revert back to windows styles, also returning to the source-tree style when hovering.

fields.description:
Dear Atlassian Team,

i working for the Volkswagen Group and we love to work with the whole Atlassian toolchain. But there is a big problem with the best GIT client (Sourcetree) we also want to use.

Since version 1.8 an unattended installation of Sourcetree is not possible. For Installation it is necessary to have an Atlassian Account.

In such a big company like Volkswagen it is not acceptable to manually install software for a bigger group of users. Please, please, please change your Installation routine back like it was before 1.8. We really want to work with Sourcetree, but you make it impossible for many many people in a big company (and i think we are not the only one) to easily work with GIT / Bitbucket.

Regards, Sven

fields.summary: Pruebas de flujo

In some circumstances the changes to the loaded Mercurial extensions doesn't save after upgrading the embedded Mercurial, if necessary toggle to System Mercurial and back to Embedded Mercurial to force the change.
If the Mercurial Credential Manager UI is closed by cancelling or using the window closing X it causes a python crash within the parent Mercurial process.

fields.description:
I've left Affects Version empty here because for some reason the version that I am using (2.1.11.0.) is not there.

I am encountering .git/index.lock errors all the time when trying to:
 * stage a file
 * make a commit

Very often I need to try to do above for 5 and more times until it finally works. 

Also sometimes clicking "commit button" makes no effect.

Because of this problem I limited my ST usage to this two things only. This bug is there for at least a year. During that period there were multiple ST updates making this even worse - at the beginning it was happening rarely, mostly with bigger interactive rebases. At this moment it is happening with everything. I was trying to use embedded git also but there was no difference.
fields.summary: .git/index.lock errors during any operation or action

fields.description:
I use a multi-monitor setup with one portrait and one landscape oriented monitor. My monitor
arrangement looks like this:
{code:java}
+------+
|      | +----------+
|      | |          |
|      | |          |
|      | +----------+
+------+{code}
I run Source Tree on the right monitor in full-screen mode.

When I try to delete a file from my working copy in the "unstaged files" list, the warning dialog that pops up is positioned *outside* the visible area of my screens, above the upper edge of the right monitor. I can only see the lower button row, but not the text of the dialog. (See attached screenshot of uppermost part of right monitor)

I assume this would happen in other heterogeneous monitor arrangements as well, and potentially with other dialogs.
fields.summary: Dialogs off-screen for multi-monitor setup

fields.description:
As per summary, after maximizing the SourceTree window, moving the mouse pointer to the bottom of the screen does not reveal the (auto-hidden) Windows taskbar as it is meant to.

 

I usually hit the Windows key to get it to re-appear. I have two monitors setup - clicking on a window on the 2nd monitor also allows the taskbar to reappear when the mouse pointer is moved to the bottom of the screen.

 

I have not extended the taskbar onto the secondary monitor.

 

I have the same issue on a single monitor setup though.
fields.summary: Maximizing Window Prevents Auto-hide Windows Taskbar Reappearing

fields.description:
After putting SourceTree to the full-screen mode, there is an option to resize the window, though it's in full-screen mode.

[pic: fullscreen_resizeable.png]

After I resized the window the SourceTree realized that it is not full-screen mode anymore, so it set its mode to windowed.

[pic: resized_from_full_screen.png]

Then I moved away the window to make sure that the error will be visible.

[pic: moved_away.png]

I clicked on the full-screen button at the top-right corner of the window, and the magic happened. This also works with dragging the window to the top of the screen.

[pic: fullscreen_magic.png]
fields.summary: Fullscreen mode broken after resize bug

fields.description: Right now, the Stash Changes dialog box has only one option, "Keep staged changes." Please add a second one: "Include untracked files," e.g., the equivalent (when checked) of *--include-untracked* on a *git stash save* command. I almost never want to stash changes without including untracked (e.g., new) files.
fields.summary: Add checkbox to include untracked files when stashing
Could you return the bookmark view to the new version

fields.description:
When I have unstaged changes, the "stage lines" or "stage hunk" buttons stop working intermittently.

The button is clickable and gives the usual hover and active states when I click it. However, nothing else happens and the changes do not get staged.

There are two workarounds that I have found:
 # Select a different unstaged file and then go back to the file you want to stage changes from. This sometimes works.
 # Restart SourceTree.
fields.summary: Stage lines button stop working intermittently

fields.description:
When using verbose git command, discarding of changes does not work, using both embedded as system git.

Error message is:
{code:java}
error: unknown switch `v'{code}
full error message:

 
{code:java}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false checkout -v --MYFILE
error: unknown switch `v'
usage: git checkout [<options>] <branch>
 or: git checkout [<options>] [<branch>] -- <file>...-q, --quiet suppress progress reporting
 -b <branch> create and checkout a new branch
 -B <branch> create/reset and checkout a branch
 -l create reflog for new branch
 --detach detach HEAD at named commit
 -t, --track set upstream info for new branch
 --orphan <new-branch>
 new unparented branch
 -2, --ours checkout our version for unmerged files
 -3, --theirs checkout their version for unmerged files
 -f, --force force checkout (throw away local modifications)
 -m, --merge perform a 3-way merge with the new branch
 --overwrite-ignore update ignored files (default)
 --conflict <style> conflict style (merge or diff3)
 -p, --patch select hunks interactively
 --ignore-skip-worktree-bits
 do not limit pathspecs to sparse entries only
 --ignore-other-worktrees
 do not check if another worktree is holding the given ref
 --progress force progress reporting
{code}
!image-2017-09-04-11-37-03-308.png!
fields.summary: Error when reverting changes when git verbose console output is enabled : unknown switch `v'

fields.description:
When trying to follow the path of a branch  I find myself more than once having to analyze the graph and wasting too much time on what should have been a trivial task. just look on the multi color line cross overs in each of these attached images. I think few improvements are critical to make our lives simpler:
 # add the ability to see a line clearly just by hoovering on it (it could go bold or change color)
 # add the ability to click a line in the graph and have it permanently use a different color (kind of a selected item color) - can only apply to one line in the graph
 # no one said line heights in the list must be the same. A junction like this with multiple lines crossing could use a higher line height to show the lines clearly
 # use a different algorithm for layout of the graph. one for example that uses horizontal lines and when multiple branches have the same parent, it does not put the lines on top of each other but lays them side by side (similar to an electronics diagram)

These would all make the usage simpler and free more time for me to do the thing I am actually payed to do which is write code and not analyze the commit graph just to trace something. 

I know I can switch to the commit I want to trace and ask to see only that commit branch but sometimes I need to track multiple commits and see how commits relate from one branch to another
fields.summary: Improve graph layout and coloring

fields.description:
Merge lines are greyed out as if they are uncommitted when the parent commit is checked out and there are uncommitted changes.

E.g.

!image-2017-09-11-16-04-08-972.png!

!image-2017-09-01-09-44-17-056.png!

 

Ideally the lines from the parent to the merge commits would remain coloured, and the grey would start only after passing the top fork.
fields.summary: Always colour graph lines from parent commits to merge commits

 * Scroll down

fields.description:
Using search the files pending files can filtered.
if we have 10 pending changes, .e.g we filter on utils leaving only 2 files visible.
after choosing stage all, only the 2 files are still listed as being commited but in the back all pending files are commited. it would be better only to stage the files visible to the user.

fields.description:
When I switch branch and then press pull to update my current branch, previously it worked that the default was the current branch. For some reason this has changed in 2.1.11 to be the branch you were in before switching. This leads too easily to messed up branches and hence I really would like to see this changed back to the old behaviour.

Repro:
 * be on branch A
 * switch branch to branch B
 * press pull
 * see that you are now by default pulling A [not ok, expected default = B]
fields.summary: Default branch to pull is no longer the current branch

After I was promted that a update was available I accepted it and restarted SourceTree. Now SourceTree does start up, shows a quick progress bar (which I can not read as it disappers pretty quickly) and then does not show anything anymore while still running according to taskmgr.

This renders SourceTree useless after the upgrade. Is there a way to diagnose where it is stuck or a way to downgrade so I can get working again?

 

This is very anoying as it limits my productivity as I am no longer able to use SourceTree and have to resort to command line or another tool

fields.description:
When doing *any* actual Git action, there is a windows that shows the run command along with the output as it would have been seen in the command-line.

The font of that output should be fixed-width (or be choosable).

Reason for that is that some of the output was designed to create shapes and charts etc... that are only well-formed and readable when using a fixed-width font.
fields.summary: Use a fixed-width font to display the output of commands

The navigation panel keep collapsing the tree structure. I can't find a scenario but this happens frequently. I always expand the "BRANCHES" and "REMOTES"  and frequently when I come back to the SourceTree window, it's all collapsed and I have to expand the "BRANCHES" again to see available branches.

Perhaps started in the previous upgrade ~1-2 weeks ago.
fields.summary: Auto-folding of branches

fields.description:
Issue: Source Tree shows no files listed that are ready to commit. Click Fetch, then all of a sudden all my file changes show up. I hurriedly left home this morning and saw no pending changes to check in, only to find that entire feature sets were missing from my repo. This resulted in a huge waste of my time, all because Source Tree did not detect that files were changed and needed to be checked in.

Don't have steps to reproduce yet
fields.summary: File changes not detected until Fetch is run

fields.description:
When I have two repositories open (in tabs) and do the following:
 * Open the file status of repo 1
 * Make a change in the code of repo 2
 * Switch to the file status op repo 2

Then the changes made are not shown. I need to unfocus SourceTree completely and refocus to trigger a refresh for my changes to show up.

 

I'd expect SourceTree to refresh when I switch tabs.
fields.summary: Not detecting changes when switching repository

fields.description:
Hi All,

   How can we install source tree offline? How is it possible on air-gapped machines?

Its not possible for all the users of source tree to connect with Atlassian account.

Please help.
fields.summary: Install Souce Tree Offline

fields.description:
Hi,

When adding a new folder to the local repositories, even renamed that folder is named "New folder" in the clone window unless i create another empty folder.

 

!image-2017-08-28-14-22-24-579.png!

 

!image-2017-08-28-14-22-44-953.png!
fields.summary: The new folders are not directly available from the clone window

fields.description: When attempting to install Version 2.1.11.0 I receive a 404 error when the installer tries to install the Git Credential Manager for Windows. See attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Sourcetree Install - 404 when trying to download Git Credential Manager
从svn服务器克隆工程时候，URL中含有 中文字符时候，会报错：这是一个无效的url

fields.description: I updated source tree from a quite old version after being informed that version was no longer going to be supported.  I added my repos back since they weren't merged in on update, and now I can't communicate with any of my remote origins.  I use an ssh key, have configured the options to point to my id_rsa key, and a command prompt window pops up asking me to input the password for my key, and as soon as I start typing it, some text pops up in the window, and the window closes.  It's too fast for me to read it.  I can't use sourcetree at all at this point.
fields.summary: ssh window flashes and goes away
Unstaged files area sometimes shows all files in repo

fields.description: I have russian Windows 10 and I'm using english version of SourceTree. Every time after updating SourceTree, interface becomes russian again. Although if I go to options, it shows "Language: English" on "General" tab. So I have to switch it to russian, then to english again, then restart program.
fields.summary: Language setting drops after update

fields.description:
After setting up a fresh SourceTree 2.2.1.0 beta on the test machine and configuring our defaults, e.g. use OpenSSH instead of PuTTY in Options there is an Exception dialog after closing Options and after every application start.

[Error encountered]                                           [x]
'ssh-agent' failed with code -1: System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
()
                                                                        [OK]
fields.summary: SourceTree 2.2.1.0 beta System.NullReferenceException switching to OpenSSH

fields.description:
When i am comiiting my changes with push my changes checkbox checked without pulling the latest change(happens at the same time or my screen did not show it).

IF that corresponding change also happened in the same root folder though files are different commit works but push is not happening.

it asks me to pull the code but pull  is also not working due to this error. IS there any solution or workaround to rollback/cancel that change without pushing or stash that code without having impact to pull.

once its pushed no way for me to cancel that push to the remote branch.if I revert it still another push is pending which is also not completing.

 no way for me to uncheck that file from the push or from pull.

please provide any workaround/solution asap
fields.summary: When i am comiiting my changes without pulling if same root folder has changes both pull and push is not working

fields.description:
SourceTree is constantly asking for my password. It doesn't matter how often I enter my password, it will keep asking for the password.

 

This happens consistently when I open a new tab in SourceTree. Also, when closing the password popup, it immediately reappears.
fields.summary: Sourcetree is constantly asking for my password

fields.description:
It would be a nice small productivity boost if after opening the Respositories Manager, the Search Input Control was automatically focused.

The user could then immediately start typing away without first having to click on the Search Field.
fields.summary: Set focus on Search Field when opening Repositories View

fields.description: As part of the setup process, SourceTree attempts to download Git Credential Manager for Windows - Fork, however it fails due to a System.Net.WebException: The remote server returned and error: (404). I also receive this error if I call the URL provided from chrome.
fields.summary: Git Credential Manager for Windows ZIP not found

fields.description: start new feature is very slowly, nearly 90 seconds
fields.summary: start new feature is very slowly

fields.description: nothing happens when I click the clone link in Remote Repositories (I was promised by source tree that it would be much easier to clone straight from sourcetree, well fact is, it is not even working)
fields.summary: Remote repositores > Clone does not work

fields.description:
Recently we have a problem that we strongly believe that sourcetree is the cause of it.

We have created packages in visual studio and commit and push them to master branch. then every now and then we find out that the changes that have been applied to packages are lost or it have returned to a previous state as if nothing happened to them.

I have used $ git reflog to check if there is any lost commits but couldn't find any. so it seems that the commits themselves are losing details or not merging properly to the previous version

 

Hope you have a solution to that problem because this have been stopping our production for a while.

Thanks and waiting for your reply
fields.summary: commits losing details

fields.description:
Hi,
 Since the upgrade to this version, I started having problems pushing and pulling to and from my Github and Bitbucket repository.

Also, in the saved passwords section in the authentication tab, I seem to have a password which I don't recognize, and I can't seem to delete it.

Please view the 2 videos attached.


 Can you please help?
fields.summary: Can't push to remote repository - username password issue

fields.description:
In fullscreen mode SourceTree's window edge is visible in other screens.
 !SourceTreeBug.jpg|width=600!
fields.summary: Fullscreen window is out of bound

fields.description:
Hi,

We have received feedback from several teams in Capital Group that sourcetree works slow and gets hung frequently.

Could you please let us know how we can improve the performance?

Thank you!
fields.summary: SourceTree works slow and gets hung frequently

fields.description:
There are many problems with diff in sourcetree, but this one is new for me.

As can be seen on attached screenshots, sourcetree doesn't highlight diff zone properly and (what's more important) it shows line numbers incorrectly. I attached the same files' comparison in meld and VS Code. See the difference.

Also

First met in current version.
fields.summary: Incorrect diff view of changes

fields.description:
Is it possible to integrate a language selector for the programm to use another language.

On my machine it is only possible to see the german language. But the translations are very confusing. I want to use the english translations.
fields.summary: Language Selector in SourceTree

fields.description: Delete button has no function.
fields.summary: Settings/Authentication/Accounts - delete button not working
Can't fetch from repo on unc path with extended characters
